headline: Ogun community fumes over monarch’s land grabber appellation
summarized_story:

headline: Ex-Chief of Army Staff Inuwa Wushishi is dead
summarized_story:
A Former Chief of Army Staff, General Mohammed Inuwa Wushishi, is dead.
General Wushishi was born in 1940 in Wushishi, Headquarters of Wushishi Local Government Area of Niger State.
Wushishi joined the army on 21 April 1961, and attended the Nigerian Military Training College, Kaduna and then the Mons Officer Cadet School, Aldershot in the United Kingdom.
He was appointed Deputy Commandant, Army School of Infantry in July 1975.
He was Chief of Army Staff (COAS) from October 1981 to October 1983 during the Shehu Shagari administration.

headline: MTN Nigeria issues 575m shares through digital public offer
summarized_story:
Nigeria’s biggest telco, MTN Nigeria, has announced that starting from Wednesday, 1 December 2021, retail investors can purchase up to 575 million shares held in MTN Nigeria at ₦169 per share—lower than its share price on the stock market.
This public offer is in line with MTN Group’s commitment to reduce its shareholding in MTN Nigeria from 78.8% to 65% over time.
Notably, this public offer is primarily digital as the shares can be purchased online.
Bolaji Balogun, CEO of Chapel Hill Denham, an investment banking firm leading the public offering, explained this to TechCabal.
In response to this public offering announcement, MTN Nigeria’s share price fell 10% on Wednesday to a five-week low, a logical response as investors rushed to buy the lower-priced MTN public offering shares.

headline: Insecurity: Osinbajo Calls For Use Of Artificial Intelligence

“It will be a major source for research and knowledge about Benin art and cultural history relating to this art.”In October the University of Aberdeen and Cambridge University’s Jesus College returned two Benin Bronzes to Nigeria.
